macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Hits Fresh All-Time Intraday High Led by Technology
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.41% to close at 6,978, reaching a new all-time intraday high driven by tech stocks, while investors position for upcoming earnings amid government shutdown concerns.

items.title: US Markets Mixed: Dow Drops 0.83%, Nasdaq Up 0.91% on Trump Comments
items.summary: The Dow Jones fell 0.83% to 49,003 amid volatility from President Trump's remarks on the dollar, while Nasdaq climbed 0.91% to 23,817; dollar index hit four-year low at 95.76.

items.title: Corporate Share Buybacks Set Records, Supporting S&P 500 Amid Foreign Buyer Pullback
items.summary: Corporate buybacks reached $982 billion in 2024 and are forecast to exceed $1.2 trillion in 2025-2026, accounting for significant S&P 500 returns, as European and foreign buyers trim US exposure due to valuations and geopolitical risks.

items.title: Commodities Surge on Weak Dollar: Gold Hits Record $5,180, Oil Up 3%
items.summary: Gold rose 3.42% to a record $5,180/oz and oil gained over 3% (Brent to $67.59, WTI to $62.48) following the dollar's 1.32% drop, its worst since April.

items.title: Busy Economic Calendar Ahead with Fed Focus and Australian CPI
items.summary: Markets brace for key data including Australian CPI (expected 0.7% monthly, 3.5% yearly) and major central bank decisions, with Fed in spotlight amid ongoing volatility.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Stabilizes Near $89,100 Amid Institutional Dip-Buying and ETF Inflows
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading around $89,100 after dipping to $86,000 earlier this week, with institutional investors resuming dip-buying and spot ETFs recording net positive inflows. Ethereum is reclaiming the $2,950–$3,000 range, supported by post-quantum security narratives and rising Layer-2 volumes.

items.title: Institutions Continue Betting Big on Bitcoin Despite 30% Drop from Peak
items.summary: A 'Charting Crypto: Q1 2026' report highlights institutional stability in Bitcoin holdings even after a 30% fall from its peak, with BTC dominance rising to 59% and on-chain metrics showing improved supply distribution. Spot volumes have stabilized, indicating market consolidation.

items.title: Standard Chartered Warns of $500 Billion Bank Deposit Shift to Stablecoins by 2028
items.summary: Standard Chartered's report predicts up to $500 billion in bank deposits could move to stablecoins by 2028 due to higher rewards and faster settlements, boosting stablecoin-related projects as a key trend for 2026.

items.title: Clarity Act Advances as Senator Drops Controversial Amendment
items.summary: The Clarity Act, aimed at regulating and legitimizing digital assets, moves closer to passage after a senator withdrew a plan targeting credit card fees, resolving opposition from Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong over stablecoin yield restrictions. The Senate Agriculture Committee is set to vote on Thursday.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Researchers Unveil VIBETENSOR: Fully AI-Generated Deep Learning System Stack
items.summary: Scientists have released VIBETENSOR, a complete open-source deep learning software stack—including tensor systems, autograd engine, and CUDA runtime—built entirely by LLM-powered AI agents with minimal human guidance. This milestone demonstrates AI's potential to automate complex software engineering at scale.

items.title: OIST Breakthrough: AI Learns Faster by 'Talking to Itself' During Training
items.summary: Researchers at Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology show that AI models with self-interaction mechanisms, like inner speech and multiple working memory slots, improve performance on multitasking and multi-step problems, even with sparse data. The approach mimics human learning for more adaptable machines.

items.title: Boston Dynamics Debuts Advanced Humanoid Robot for Fine-Motor Tasks
items.summary: Boston Dynamics launched a new humanoid platform excelling in high-agility, fine-motor tasks under unpredictable conditions. Parallel developments include Japan testing empathetic robot-nurses and DARPA addressing ethics in autonomous battlefield robotics.

items.title: China Accelerates AI Independence with 'AI Tigers' and National AI+ Initiative
items.summary: China shifts from following Western AI to leading with homegrown generative models, humanoid systems like DeepSeek’s R1 and XPeng’s IRON, aiming to integrate AI across production and life by 2030.

items.title: Gallup Survey Reveals Uneven AI Adoption in US Workplaces
items.summary: A Gallup Workforce survey of over 23,000 US workers shows AI use growing but fragmented by role, industry, and organization, concentrated among knowledge workers, with many employees uncertain about their employer's adoption.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Capcom Shares Surge on Strong Resident Evil Sales
items.summary: Capcom's stock jumped up to 12% on January 28, 2026, marking its biggest single-day gain in 18 months after December-quarter earnings exceeded expectations, driven by robust sales of older titles like Resident Evil.

items.title: Mobile Legends: Bang Bang Unveils 2026 Global Esports Roadmap
items.summary: MOONTON Games announced a five-region esports overhaul for Mobile Legends: Bang Bang, aiming for over 70 regions, 5,000 events, and 600 million hours watched in 2026, following the M7 World Championship's record 5.68 million peak viewers.

items.title: Vietnam's Panthera Global Secures $1.5M Seed Funding
items.summary: Panthera Global, a Vietnamese mid-core game studio, raised $1.5 million in seed funding on January 28, 2026, to expand its global RPG portfolio.

items.title: LOTRO Servers Scheduled for Maintenance Downtime
items.summary: The Lord of the Rings Online (LOTRO) game worlds will be unavailable from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM Eastern on January 28, 2026, for weekly maintenance.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
